oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Microcomputers in dairy practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sterner, K. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: computers
Milk production
Veterinary practice
cows
data processing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The field of computer technology is affecting all facets of our lives, not the least of which may be our veterinary practices. Articles in recent veterinary journals are quick to point out the advantages of a computer system in a practice. Two small card programmable computers (CPCs) have been in use in this veterinary practice for the past year. Judging from field experience, the small microcomputer can be a valuable tool in the diagnosis and correction of herd nutritional problems.
